data.title: Nominate someone for an award
data.meta_description: Anyone wanting a person to be awarded a Swedish Order or a Swedish Medal should make a nomination.
data.text:
Anyone who would like an individual – Swedish, foreign or stateless – to receive one of the Royal Orders of Chivalry should use the suggestion form – see the link below.

The Order of the Seraphim – for the Swedish Royal Family and, at the Government’s recommendation, for heads of state or individuals of equal status.

The Order of the Sword – for military personnel who have made personal efforts within the military field for Sweden or for Swedish interests.

The Order of the Polar Star – for individuals who have made personal efforts for Sweden or for Swedish interests, especially within public activities, as well as the successful performance of public duties and assignments.

The Order of Vasa – for individuals who have made personal efforts for Sweden or for Swedish interests, especially within non-public sector operations, as well as the successful performance of public duties and assignments..

Nomination Form for the Orders of Knighthood Pdf, 1 MB, opens in new window.

Anyone who wants a Swedish citizen to receive a royal medal uses the proposal form for medal proposals, see link below.

The Seraphim Medal – for exceptional humanitarian or deed of general public benefit.

H.M. the King's Medal – for special merits.

The Medal Litteris et Artibus – for artistic contributions mainly in music, scenical presenation and literature.

The Prince Eugen Medal – for artistic contributions in other fields.

The Prince Carl Medal – for national or international humanitarian activities.

Nomination Form for Medals Pdf, 2 MB, opens in new window.

Completed and signed form is sent to:

Kungl. Maj:ts Orden

Kungl. Slottet

107 70 Stockholm

SWEDEN

Government Medals

In addition to the above, the Swedish government awards four royal medals:

The Medal Illis Quorum Meruere Labores (For Those Whose Work Have Made Them Therof Worthy)

The Medal För berömliga gärningar (For Noble Deeds) - for life-saving deeds

The Medal För medborgerlig förtjänst (For Civic Merit) - extant

The Medal För omsorgsfull renvård (For Diligent Reindeer Husbandry)

In addition, a medal that counts as a government medal is included in the award För nit och redlighet i rikets tjänst (For Zeal and Devotion in the Service of the Realm), which is awarded for 30 years in state service, 25 years of service upon retirement.
